metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25643 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
seatd-launch in seatd 0.6.x before 0.6.4 allows removing files with escalated privileges when installed setuid root. The attack vector is a user-supplied socket pathname.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25643` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libseat1 - 0.7.0-5
seatd - 0.7.0-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: seatd package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.0-5').
